I do think whoever is nominated will get the support of the party, because they do want to beat Trump, but getting there may leave someone really battered.

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: You need to be jazzed, right? You need to be jazzed.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: You absolutely do. But if you look at the constituencies that are backing Joe Biden right now, the African-American community is quite jazzed about him. We have moderates all over the country, like the ones who got us 2018, who are jazzed about it. It's a long way out. But I don't think that John Delaney or John Hickenlooper getting booed at this is some harbinger of disaster to come for Democrats that are running as moderates.

utterances.speaker: WILKES
utterances.utterance: But it wasn't just Hickenlooper and Delaney who were being critical of some Democrats. It was Warren who -- and Bernie who were tacitly being critical and Joe Biden.

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: And stand up for that crime bill, for God's sake. It was a good measure.

utterances.speaker: WILKES
utterances.utterance: Joe Biden was talking -- or -- sorry -- Elizabeth Warren was talking about how it's not the time for small ideas, but big ideas. That's directly opposite what Joe Biden is talking about, a status quo.

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: All right, we have a lot more coming up, including that a ship has come in that, a fat, out-of-shape guy who takes the heavyweight championship of the world from a guy who was built like Adonis. Proof, as I have always told you, that all the donuts you can eat will not stop you from becoming the athletic king of the world -- after this.

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: All right, we told you a little bit earlier, we're finding out a little more, that House Democrats are holding the attorney general, William Barr, and Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross in contempt of Congress for defying a panel's subpoena for information about that citizenship question in the 2020 census, said it didn't belong there. What was the germ for that? The Washington Examiner's Tiana Lowe on all of this. Tiana, where is this going?

utterances.speaker: TIANA LOWE, THE WASHINGTON EXAMINER
utterances.utterance: It just goes to show Democrats -- this is an extreme thing to be challenging the Trump administration on. The notion that our census should reflect the amount of legal immigrants we have here, the number of actual citizens that we have, in order to properly apportion seats in the House of Representatives, this shouldn't be a controversial thing that they're doing. But this isn't just a case of Democrats wanting to stonewall the Trump administration. This is them sort of showing their commitment to having illegal immigrants represented in our voting records.

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: Well, the one thing I thought about this, because I know we used to have this question years ago in census questions. I would want to get to the bottom of, why was it taken off in the first place? That could be a separate area, but, nevertheless, they're wanting to look for what was the genesis for putting this question back in there. Do we even know whether it's bad or good? I mean, whatever your feelings are, do we know how it got back in there? And does it matter?

utterances.speaker: LOWE
utterances.utterance: It really materially shouldn't matter, because the explicit legal intention of the question is to make sure that citizens are represented in the House, to make sure that we are not inappropriately allocating extra representation towards people who are not legal citizens of this country. This is not an extreme position. This is not about rounding up illegal immigrants. This is not about deporting dreamers. This is simply making sure that legal citizens and the legal immigrants have their proper representation in Congress.

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: If you're illegal, why would you even fill out the form one way or the other, whether it asks for your place of birth or whether you're an American citizen or not?

utterances.speaker: LOWE
utterances.utterance: So, obviously, if you are -- not to generalize, if you're, say, an illegal immigrant in a state like California, which openly wants to provide socialized -- which openly wants to provide Medi-Cal...

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: This would be a way to get that. This would be a way to get that.

utterances.speaker: LOWE
utterances.utterance: Yes, this could be a way to enhance your representation, particularly from the Democratic Party, in a national level.

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: All right, Tiana, thank you very, very much, The Washington Examiner's Tiana Lowe. We have a lot more coming up, including more from the first lady and the president of the United States right now enjoying dinner at Buckingham Palace, the third president to be so honored. We will have an update from London after this.

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: All right, they're eating dinner right now in Her Majesty's kingdom with Her Majesty there at the main table. We're talking about the president and Mrs. Trump, Melania Trump, being feted like royalty in London. FOX Business Network's Ed Lawrence has been getting updates constantly, updates us right now -- Ed.

utterances.speaker: EDWARD LAWRENCE, FOX NEWS BUSINESS CORRESPONDENT
utterances.utterance: Yes, exactly, Neil. Yes, the president there with his wife, his family, the royal family at that state banquet. The queen only holds about two state visits per year. So, this on the significance level, is pretty high. Three U.S. presidents have this distinction, President Bush in 2003, President Obama in 2011, and now President Trump here. Now, within the last hour, the queen of England toasted the United States.  Listen.

utterances.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH II, UNITED KINGDOM
utterances.utterance: While the world has changed, we are forever mindful of the original purpose of these structures, nations working together to safeguard a hard-won peace.

utterances.speaker: LAWRENCE
utterances.utterance: And in -- during his toast, the president talked about the enduring bonds between the U.S. and the United Kingdom. Listen.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: On behalf of all Americans, I offer a toast to the eternal friendship of our people, the vitality of our nations, and to the long- cherished and truly remarkable reign of Her Majesty, the queen.

utterances.speaker: LAWRENCE
utterances.utterance: And, tomorrow, President Trump will be meeting business roundtable leaders -- business leaders at a roundtable with Prime Minister Theresa May. She wants to talk about climate change with the president. The president wants to talk about your trade and the security risk of Huawei -- back to you, Neil.

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: All right, thank you very much, my friend, Ed Lawrence. These have been tough times for the Brits, if you think about it, obviously trying to separate from the rest of the Europe. That's gotten to be almost impossible. The prime minister is on her way out. We don't know who's going to replace her. They're wondering about where they're going to drive up business. And their British boxing champ, the sort of the envy of the world, the man who united all the heavyweight titles under one belt, was beaten by a guy who looks like me.

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: You know, if boxing were as big as it was some years ago, when Buster Douglas stunned the world and knocked out Mike Tyson, or out of the blue Muhammad Ali beat this monster called George Foreman, this would have gotten front-page play and been known everywhere. Andy Ruiz, a journeymen, as they like to say, a Mexican boxer by descent, doesn't look like fit as a fiddle. Maybe that's in the eye of the beholder. And who am I to judge? But I'm telling you, this guy is now my hero.

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: Because, out of nowhere, a guy who looks like me -- actually, I look a tad better than this dude.

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: He took down the undefeated heavyweight champion of the world, who, as I said, was a 12-1 favorite. And he made it look easy. Comedian, and boxing historian, radio host Joe Piscopo with us now. But you and I can remember when something like this would have been everywhere.

utterances.speaker: JOE PISCOPO, COMEDIAN
utterances.utterance: I love -- why am I working out?

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: I know. Exactly.

utterances.speaker: PISCOPO
utterances.utterance: Why am I even bothering? Look at this guy.

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: You know what curling is for me? Like some sandwiches.

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: It's Snickers bars, right?

utterances.speaker: PISCOPO
utterances.utterance: Yes, Snickers bars.

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: That's part of his gig.

utterances.speaker: PISCOPO
utterances.utterance: There it is right there.

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: But this guy just beat him to a pulp.

utterances.speaker: PISCOPO
utterances.utterance: I know. I love it. I hear these -- my boxing friends told me he's got quick hands like that.  But it's -- I'm working out. I'm dieting.

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: Right, right, right.

utterances.speaker: PISCOPO
utterances.utterance: I'm trying to be chiseled and ripped and everything. This guy shows up. And I said, this...

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: Well, I talked to doctors about this who were saying, you know, you know how you look has nothing to do with how fit you are. I said, well, thank goodness.

utterances.speaker: PISCOPO
utterances.utterance: And you know Britain's just hating this whole thing.

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: They finally have -- go back to Joe Bugner days. They had a champ who then takes one title after another.

utterances.speaker: PISCOPO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: He was treated like a rock star.

utterances.speaker: PISCOPO
utterances.utterance: I know. And this guy Joshua, he fills 90,000 at Wembley.

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: Oh, yes, he sold out.

utterances.speaker: PISCOPO
utterances.utterance: So, we get a royal treatment to President Trump, which they can't stand.

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: Oh, yes.

utterances.speaker: PISCOPO
utterances.utterance: And now an American, a Mexican-American, beats their number one star. I say. I say.

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: And it's true. He eats a candy bar before every match and after it, apparently during.

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: And it wasn't even close.

utterances.speaker: PISCOPO
utterances.utterance: Can I tell you a secret on this show, because I love you and it's great to see you? When I -- if I have to rush into the early morning radio, this is -- and this -- only because it's made in Jersey, M&M, Mars, you know?

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: Oh, sure.

utterances.speaker: PISCOPO
utterances.utterance: I have a Snickers bar. So it is good, you know?

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: Try Three Musketeers.

utterances.speaker: PISCOPO
utterances.utterance: Yes, Three Musketeers.

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: But I digress.

utterances.speaker: PISCOPO
utterances.utterance: You know what? I'm ready. I'm ready just to throw everything to the wayside. I'm trying to stay healthy. I'm not going to do it.

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: But isn't that wild?

utterances.speaker: PISCOPO
utterances.utterance: Yes. I love it.

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: I mean, you -- your whole career, if you think about it, you nonstop keep at it.

utterances.speaker: PISCOPO
utterances.utterance: Yes, yes.

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: This Ruiz guy, everyone dismissed him.

utterances.speaker: PISCOPO
utterances.utterance: I would be, if I looked like that guy, a big star.

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: You already are, young man.

utterances.speaker: PISCOPO
utterances.utterance: No, I'll tell you what.

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: But you know what I'm reminded? And I always -- we always tell our kids this and all. You just don't listen to the odds. Don't listen to those saying you can't, you won't, you won't do this -- although this guy's had a great boxing career himself.

utterances.speaker: PISCOPO
utterances.utterance: But don't forget George Foreman was big. He was a big guy. The second George Foreman...

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: And, by the way, Ali taking him on in Kinshasa, Zaire, it wasn't that Ali was some shrinking violet or not fit enough to take...

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: This guy...

utterances.speaker: PISCOPO
utterances.utterance: This guy -- you could look for a grill coming from this guy, an infomercial in the middle of the night.

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: Or to pop out of a grill, yes.

utterances.speaker: PISCOPO
utterances.utterance: He could be. He could be.

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: But it changed everything. It changed everything. But maybe the sadder part in this is that boxing just isn't what it was, you know?

utterances.speaker: PISCOPO
utterances.utterance: But this is the best thing to happen to boxing.

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: Yes

utterances.speaker: PISCOPO
utterances.utterance: Yes. It's great for the Mexican-American community. It's great for America.

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: Can you imagine the Snickers folks? They're going to be doing deals.

utterances.speaker: PISCOPO
utterances.utterance: I'll tell you, but don't forget how big a star George Foreman became.

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: Absolutely.

utterances.speaker: PISCOPO
utterances.utterance: Butterbean -- remember that guy Butterbean? Butterbean was..

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: Right. You're right about that. Well, Foreman morphed into...

utterances.speaker: PISCOPO
utterances.utterance: Tony "Two Ton" Galento, you remember.

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: Oh, you're right. You're right.

utterances.speaker: PISCOPO
utterances.utterance: Of course. Yes, I wasn't even born yet.

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: Neither was I. Don't give that away. But you think about it, Foreman changed his whole personality. He became very likable.

utterances.speaker: PISCOPO
utterances.utterance: That's right. That's exactly right.

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: He was a mean dude when he was boxing. This guy already is the Foreman, nice, funny guy, self-deprecating. He said, I was worried about losing a little weight, and I had to double up.

utterances.speaker: PISCOPO
utterances.utterance: Was there a weigh-in with this guy?

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: There was too. He was -- what, was it 268 pounds?

utterances.speaker: PISCOPO
utterances.utterance: And they let it go, man.

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: And they let it go, said, go ahead.

utterances.speaker: PISCOPO
utterances.utterance: I love it.

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: But, apparently, he's a heck of a puncher.

utterances.speaker: PISCOPO
utterances.utterance: Honestly, it's great for America. It's great for the boxing world. And I just love in England how they're just taking shots at our president, and then here we just took out their number one fighter.

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PISCOPO
utterances.utterance: I'm just saying, it's...

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: I know, the whole Brexit thing. And then they say, what do you mean, we lost the heavyweight championship?

utterances.speaker: PISCOPO
utterances.utterance: Yes, baby, like Austin Powers.

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: PISCOPO
utterances.utterance: Yeah, baby, yeah.

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: Oh. Do I make you wish for a championship? All right, thank you, my friend. Great seeing you. Continued success.  You look -- there's a guy who has not gained a pound.

utterances.speaker: PISCOPO
utterances.utterance: Oh, I'm eating. I'm eating Snickers right now.

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: But that's no longer -- that's no longer in these days, my friends, all right?

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: I am breaking news right here. All right, that will do it.
